THE STABILIZER WITH A TRAILING BROOM CART WAITED AT THETOP OF SPRING SWITCH UNTIL THE MACHINES HAS STOPPED.  OPERATOR THEN PROCEEDED THROUGH THE SWITCH ANDDOWN THE 15 % GRADE.  OPERATOR, REALIZING HE WAS UNABLE TO STOP, ALERTED THE OUTER MACHINE OPERATORS WHO PULLED THEIR EQUIPMENT FURTHER FORWARD AND THEN GOT OFF THEIR EQUIPMENT. THE STABILIZER STRUCKTHE EQUIPMENT CAUSING A DOMINO EFFECT OF DAMAGE.  PIECE OF RENTAL EQUIPMENT WAS UNABLE TO STOP IN SUFFICIENT TIME DUE TO POOR BRAKE.  BEFORE REPAIR MACHINE WAS UNABLE TO STOP WITHIN 239' WHERE AS AFTER REPAIR MACHINE STOPPED WITHIN 15'.

THEY PROCEDED 1565 FT TO THE MILL PAPER SWITCH WHERE THREE OF THE DERAILEDCARS OVERTURNED CAUSING THE TRAIN TO GO INTO EMERGENCY. EVIDENCE INDICATES THAT SIX CARS WERE DERAILED.

03104-d-02-22-03-URR.Narrative: TRAIN WAS BEING SHOVED DOWN THE LOW GRADE TRACK, THROUGH #4 INBOUND TRACK AND OUT ONTO THE PORT PERRY LEAD.  TRAIN CONSISTED OF (NEXT TO LOCOMOTIVES) 4 LOADS (GONS OF SLABS) FOLLOWED BY 15 EMPTY GONSAND 21 LOADS (COILS) THAT WERE LAST OUT.  DUE TO PHYSICAL CHARACTERISTICS OF THE TRACK (CURVATURE AND GRADE), REAR OF TRAIN (LOADS) WERE ON AN INCLINE AS THE HEADEND WAS STILL ON A DECLINING GRADE ANDEMPTYS WERE ON A MOSTLY LEVEL AREA.  TRAIN MAKE UP, CAUSED FORCES FROM LOADS ON REAR OF TRAIN AND POWER FROM HEADEND, TO CREATE SEVERE COUPLER FORCE (BUFF) AT A TURNOUT, ON THE EMPTY GON (CSXT 486882) THAT WAS NEXT TO THE 21 LOADS, CAUSING CAR WHEELS TO CLIMB OFF RAIL AND DERAIL FOLLOWED BY THREE ADJACENT GONS (EMPTY TO DERAIL AS TRAIN CONTINUED TO BE SHOVED, DERAILED CARS STRUCK THE RIGHT SIDE ARCH SUPPORT OF THE UNION JUNCTION BRIDGE (SHORTWAY) CAUSING EXTENSIVE DAMAGE TO A BRIDGE SUPPORT.  REPORTED TO NRC ON 2/24/03 AT 0900 TO REPORT #637651 REPORTED TO PUC (TO SEND FRA FROM 54 TO PUC WHENCOMPLETED).  NOTE: ORIGINAL ESTIMATE FROM ON SCENE $500,000.  THIS AMOUNT REPORTED, UPON FURTHER CALCULATIONS FROM ENGINEERING SERVICES, REVISED ESTIMATE $750,000 FOR STRUCTURE REPAIRS.

586-d-02-27-03-VTR.Narrative: AMTRAK 291 CAME INTO RUTLAND AND DROPPED OFF THEIR PASSENGERS AT THE STATION, AND THEN PROCEEDED THROUGH THE YARD TO TURN THEIR TRAIN ON THE WYE.  AFTER AMTRAK 291 HAD TURNED THEIR TRAIN AND WERE HEADING NORTH BACK TO THE MANSFIELD TRACK ON THE RUTLAND RUNNING TRACK, THEY DERAILED AT MI. 54.42 ON CURVE BEHIND THE RUTLAND SHOPPING CENTER.  UPON INVESTIGATION FOUND THAT THE LEAD RIGHT HAND WHEEL OFTHE NORTH TRUCK ON ENGINE 716 HAD GONE ON GROUND ALONG WITH THE LEAD RIGHT HAND WHEEL OF THE FOLLOWING TRUCK ON THE ENGINE AND THE LEAD RIGHT HAND WHEEL OF THE FIRST COACH BEHIND THE ENGINE.  THE ENGINE TRAVELED ONE HUNDRED AND SIXTEEN FEET (116') ON THE GROUND FROM POD (POINT OF DERAILMENT) TO WHERE THE ENGINE CAME TO A STOP.  FOUND THE CAUSE OF THE DERAILMENT TO BE BECAUSE OF TWO BROKEN GAGE RODS AT A RAIL JOINT, WITH A CONTRIBUTING CAUSE OF EXCESSIVE RAIL WEAR ON THE HIGH SIDE OF CURVE CAUSING WIDE GAGE AND THE THREE RIGHT HAND WHEELS TO DROP INSIDE THE GAGE.

NO HAZARDOUS MATERIALS WERE RELEASED

NW0203110-d-02-15-03-BNSF.Narrative: THE Z-CHCPTL1-13A CREW PULLED THEIR TRAIN INTO TRACK 43 AND DOUBLED TO TRACK 40.  CONDUCTOR MADE THECUT ON 43 AND PULLED UP AND LINED THE SWITCH INTO 40. HE PROCEEDED THE MOVEMENT IN A VAN AND TOLD THE ENGINEERTO BRING THEM BACK, RUNNING OVER THE DERAIL AND DERAILING 3 CARS, TWO 5 PACKS AND ONE THREE PACK.CONSIST CONTAINED ARTICULATED CARS. NW0203111-d-02-17-03-BNSF.Narrative: BNSF CREW SWITCHING ON NORTH LEAD, RUNNING BACKWARDS THROUGH THE 1 TO 2 CROSSOVER.  THE YARDMASTER TOLD THE UP LIL501-15 CREW TO PULL SOUTH TOWARDS 1 TRACK TO MAKE A DOUBLE-OVER INTO THE B YARD.  THEUP CREW PULLED UP AND LINED THE NORTH END OF THE CROSSOVER AND THEN STARTED TO PULL SOUTH.  THE UP BRAKEMAN WAS GOING TO LINE THE SOUTH END OF THE CROSSOVER, BUT THE BNSF CREW WAS PULLING NORTH AND HEDID NOT GET THE SWITCH LINED  AND WAS ON A DIFFERENT RADIO CHANNEL.  BNSF CREW HIT THE UP TRAIN.
